jobs.description: Join the Google Search team to build fast, responsive, and accessible user interfaces using React, TypeScript, and Web Components. Collaborate with UX researchers and product managers to shape features impacting millions. Strong knowledge of performance optimization, a11y, and scalable component architecture is required.
jobs.notes: Applied through company website. HR mentioned they'll get back in 2 weeks.

jobs.description: Work on Microsoft Teams’ collaboration tools using Vue 3 and Pinia. Build real-time interfaces that sync across multiple users. You’ll participate in design reviews, contribute to a shared design system, and write testable code using Jest and Cypress.
jobs.notes: Phone screening went well. Technical interview scheduled for next week.

jobs.description: Develop full-stack features for Facebook Groups using React, GraphQL, and Hack (PHP). You'll work with cross-functional teams, optimize backend APIs, and ensure a seamless UI/UX experience. Ideal for developers comfortable with rapid iteration and data-driven decisions.
jobs.notes: Offer received! Salary negotiation in progress.

jobs.description: Lead frontend development for Netflix's playback analytics dashboard using React, D3.js, and TypeScript. You'll focus on performance tuning, SSR, and accessibility while mentoring junior engineers and contributing to architectural decisions.
jobs.notes: Made it to final round but didn't get selected. Good feedback received.

jobs.description: Help shape the future of Dropbox’s mobile experience using React Native. You’ll build reusable UI components, collaborate with design teams, and ensure platform consistency across Android and iOS. Familiarity with native bridges and CI/CD pipelines is a plus.
jobs.notes: Applied via LinkedIn. Waiting for recruiter response.

jobs.description: Improve the accessibility of Airbnb’s search and booking interfaces using React and WCAG 2.1 guidelines. Collaborate with designers and QA to build inclusive user experiences. Prior experience with screen readers and keyboard navigation is highly valued.
jobs.notes: Initial tech screening passed. Final interview next week.

jobs.description: Develop UI components for Stripe Dashboard using TypeScript, React, and styled-components. Work closely with design systems and accessibility teams to ensure visual consistency. Emphasis on code readability, testability, and design tokens.
jobs.notes: Applied via referral from a former colleague.

jobs.description: Join the artist tools team to create data-driven interfaces using Next.js, Tailwind CSS, and GraphQL. You'll help artists track revenue, engagement, and audience insights. Experience with data visualization and animation is a plus.
jobs.notes: Verbal offer received, waiting on written letter.

jobs.description: Improve Core Web Vitals and runtime performance of Jira’s frontend. Use profiling tools like Chrome DevTools, WebPageTest, and React DevTools. Collaborate with infra teams to build tooling for bundle analysis and lazy loading strategies.
jobs.notes: Completed take-home assignment. Onsite interview scheduled.

jobs.description: Enhance GitHub’s internal DX tools using React, Node.js, and GraphQL. Build custom CLIs and dashboard UIs to help engineers ship faster. Strong emphasis on testing, observability, and documentation-first practices.
jobs.notes: Submitted application via internal referral. Awaiting update.

jobs.description: Contribute to Adobe Express web editor using modern JavaScript, WebAssembly, and Web Workers. You'll work on real-time collaboration, canvas rendering, and reusable UI widgets. Strong experience with modular frontend systems required.
jobs.notes: Received a rejection after second interview. Will reapply next cycle.

jobs.description: Build high-impact, interactive UIs for streamers and viewers using React, WebSockets, and Tailwind. You'll collaborate with real-time infrastructure teams and ship updates weekly. Experience with live video overlays and analytics preferred.

Join LinkedIn’s frontend platform team to evolve shared libraries, tooling, and frameworks used by 300+ engineers. You'll work with technologies like React, TypeScript, and webpack. Responsibilities include improving DX, managing design tokens, and leading RFC discussions for internal tooling upgrades.
jobs.notes: Resume tailored to match job description. Submitted via company portal.

jobs.description: Develop and maintain Slack's messaging interface using React, Redux, and custom internal frameworks. You'll be expected to work closely with the accessibility and design systems team to ship highly polished, production-ready features with great keyboard and screen reader support.
jobs.notes: Passed recruiter screen. Awaiting frontend live coding round.

jobs.description: Work on rich-text editing, canvas interactions, and collaborative UI features using React and ProseMirror. Collaborate with designers in a fast-paced environment focused on simplicity, performance, and UX polish. Bonus if you’ve worked on low-latency real-time apps or internal tools.
jobs.notes: Rejected after virtual onsite. Overall positive experience.

jobs.description: Support product engineers by building tooling, CI integrations, and performance instrumentation across Figma's frontend stack. This includes improving bundling strategies, browser test infrastructure, and telemetry pipelines using TypeScript, esbuild, and Playwright.
jobs.notes: Application submitted via employee referral. No response yet.

jobs.description: Work on Zoom’s web conferencing platform, focusing on latency improvements, responsive UI, and modular architecture. Leverage WebRTC, React, and Canvas APIs to build real-time interaction layers. Strong debugging and cross-browser support skills required.
jobs.notes: Final offer includes signing bonus. Awaiting HR paperwork.

jobs.description: Contribute to Asana’s task management and timeline views using React and Relay. You’ll build reusable components, work on GraphQL-powered data models, and ensure accessibility standards across feature releases. Strong collaboration and unit testing experience expected.
jobs.notes: Portfolio reviewed positively. Panel interview scheduled.
